column4: Hey everyone- I have an issue that someone was helping me with earlier... perhaps one of you can help me finish it off?
basically, I'm trying to install kdelibs5-dev so that I can build konversation-12-alpha6
but my repos are all messed up, and it tells me that is is dependent on soundlibs2-dev but wont install
right now, I'm trying to fix the repos... but when I try to attain a gpg, it gives me this: http://pastebin.com/m61c4a849
show ls -l `/home/brandon/.gnupg/gpg.conf'
-rw------- 1 brandon 1000 28 2009-05-06 10:14 /home/brandon/.gnupg/gpg.conf
hmm what's 1 user?
me?
the problem is with unsafe permissions (or ownership) -- try chown brandon.brandon `/home/brandon/.gnupg/gpg.conf'
invalid user brandon,brandon I put a space, gave me same thing
:D bad fonts :D
still cant copy?
about to try again...
I get same errors when I try to get a gpg
ohh, sorry, I messed up with other guy :D who asked about coping files
oh, lol... I was wondering whyt you said"copy"
hmm interesting, what if you try to backup this file and then remove -- may be it will be recreated
back up and remove ~/.gnupg/gpg.conf?
yep, but do backup first
no such file or directory when I rm'd
but the file does exist... twice, actually...
hmm, try rm -rf
it was in your home dir -- do it without sudo
